walkthrough.java.runtime:
Make sure you have at least on Java runtime installed.
[Install New JDK](command:toSide:java.installJdk.fromWalkthrough)
walkthrough.java.projects:
Java Project Explorer helps you to manage your projects and dependencies. It also helps you to create new Java project, classes and packages. 
[View Java Projects](command:javaProjectExplorer.focus)
walkthrough.java.projects.inactive:
In Java Projects explorer, you can browse your projects, view classpaths and dependencies. To get full feautures, you should create or open a folder containing Java projects.
[Open Command Palette](command:workbench.action.showCommands)
__Try searching for 'Create Java Project' or 'Open Folder'__
walkthrough.java.debugAndTest:
The debugger will automatically find the entry point of your project, launch it and start debugging. [Learn More...](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/java/java-debugging)
The [Testing View](command:testExplorer.focus) show all the test cases in your project. You can also run/debug your test cases from here. [Learn More...](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/java/java-testing)
[Show Run and Debug View](command:workbench.view.debug)
walkthrough.java.extensions:
Additional support for major toolchains, frameworks and application servers.
[Browse Recommended Extensions](command:toSide:java.extGuide)
walkthrough.java.more:
- Particularly if you want to run your project with a specific runtime, you can [Configure Java Runtime](command:toSide:java.runtime).
